com.inqwell.any

Class SendRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inqwell.any.AbstractFunc
      • com.inqwell.any.SendRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Any, EventListener, Func, NamedFunc, Serializable, Cloneable

    public class SendRequest
extends AbstractFunc
implements EventListener, Cloneable
    Forms a service request with an optional response specification and sends it to the specified channel.

    This class may be used in part of an expression or as an event listener. When acting as an event listener all references to nodes in the in the 'owning' structure must be already resolved when the event is processed since it may be being received from another thread. The method eventReady() should be called before attaching to a generator to do this.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.6 $
    Author:
    $Author: sanderst $
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public boolean processEvent(Event e)
                     throws AnyException
        Send the service request represented by this object as a result of event processing.

        Events may propagate from one thread A to another B when both threads are observers of the same object. When thread A raises an event on a shared object

      • getDesiredEventTypes

        public Array getDesiredEventTypes()
        Description copied from interface: EventListener
        Returns the event types this listener would like to listen to. Can be called by an EventGenerator's addEventListener() methods for those cases where the generator supports subscription to specific event types and the listener wishes to specify the event types it wants to receive notification of.
        Specified by:
        getDesiredEventTypes in interface EventListener

      • resolveOperands

        public void resolveOperands(Any a)
                     throws AnyException
        Resolve all operands in advance of calling the exec method so that when the exec is called it is thread-safe. Note that once this method has been called all original operands which were LocateNode references become normal references so the instance can never be re-used at a different context structure.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • eventReady

        public void eventReady(Process p)
                throws AnyException
        Set things up so that we are ready to process events with thread safety. This method should be called prior to connecting to any event generators.
        Throws:
        AnyException
